items.title: Garrett the Smith
items.content:
Garrett the Smith

Overview

The Discreet Craftsman Profession: Smith Location: The Whetstone and Anvil, Lesser Sacral District, Veinspire Role: Contact, Equipment Source, Information

Garrett is a trustworthy smith with four generations of metalwork in his family. He doesn't ask questions and doesn't talk to the Church.

Appearance

A smith in his fifties with thick arms and burn scars. Hands that have shaped steel for decades.

The Whetstone and Anvil: His shop in the Lesser Sacral District. Well-maintained forge, quality work on display.

Personality

  • Professional and discreet
  • Helpful to those Seraphine trusts
  • Doesn't involve himself in Church politics
  • Curious about unusual materials and legends
  • Fair in his dealings

Background

Thirty-two years of smithing experience. Four generations of metalwork in his family. Twenty years ago, he found pre-Sovereign gear on a corpse in the Underways — an experience that opened his eyes to what exists beneath the surface.

Relationships

Seraphine Vale

Seraphine directed the party to Garrett:

"The Whetstone and Anvil. Three blocks east. Garrett's place — he doesn't ask questions and he doesn't talk to the Church."

Garrett already knew they were coming:

"She came by this morning. Told me if anyone showed up asking for shelter, I should give it. Said she might be about to do something stupid."

What They Know

Legends of Mythical Items

The Martyr's Gauntlet:
  • Supposed to be in Grand Cathedral vault
  • Pedestal is empty — has been for decades/centuries
  • Protects from lies/illusions
The Bleeding Blade:
  • Deep catacombs, below Tribunal operations
  • Made from crystallized divine blood
  • Wounds never stop bleeding
  • Area unmapped, people don't return
The Underways Warden Armor:
  • Pre-Sovereign full plate
  • Garrett saw it standing empty in the tunnels
  • When he returned a week later — gone
  • "Like it walked away on its own"
The Silenced Knight's Armor:
  • Knight supposedly killed a Sovereign permanently
  • Imhuran erased the event from history
  • Sealed in Tribunal's deepest prison

Services

Smithing

  • Basic weapon repair/maintenance
  • Armor repair (patching, not full restoration)
  • Custom work (limited by time)
  • Assessment of unusual materials

The Custodian Armplate

  • Tested the pre-Sovereign metal for Jonas
  • Metal takes heat, but slowly
  • His forge isn't hot enough to shape it properly
  • Needs divine-fire heat or equivalent

items.title: Kaleth Vorn
items.content:
Kaleth Vorn

Overview

Kaleth Vorn was the Tribunal's chief assassin — a cynical murderer who spent thirty years hunting the Seven Heretics. He didn't believe in the Sanguine Doctrine; he simply found faith useful for controlling others.

He died in less than four seconds when Mira Alethain rose in Undying Conviction.

Appearance

A gaunt man in his late fifties with hollow cheeks and cold, amused eyes. Iron-grey hair, cropped short and practical. Moved with the casual confidence of someone who had never been truly challenged. Wore dark clerical robes over light armor, with the inverted holy symbol of Mareatha displayed openly.

His smile never reached his eyes. It was the smile of a man who found the universe's cruelty privately hilarious.

He wore six rings on a chain around his neck. Trophies. One of them belonged to Elias Alethain.

Personality

From his journal:

"Sometimes I wonder if any of them actually believe. I stopped believing decades ago. The doctrine is useful — nothing more. Faith is a tool for controlling the faithful."

What Kaleth actually believed:
  • The Sanguine Doctrine is a convenient fiction
  • The Sovereigns are parasites wearing the corpse of a god, but useful ones
  • Heresy isn't a sin — it's a threat to a functional system
  • People need lies to function; truth is corrosive
  • He was simply better than the fools he eliminated

Background

The Thirty-Year Hunt

When the Seven Heretics fled Veinspire, the Tribunal assigned Kaleth Vorn to eliminate them.

His approach was different from other Inquisitors:

  • Patience — tracked them for years before striking
  • Precision — clean kills, no witnesses, no martyrs
  • Cruelty — every death was designed to look like fate's punishment
  • Trophies — kept something from each kill

Over thirty years, he killed six of the seven:

Year Target Method Notes
3 Aldric Sarne Poison Veinspire
8 Elias Alethain Fall (staged) Mira's husband — pushed off cliff
12 Corwin Marsh Blade Dusthollow
17 Daven Holt Bandits (hired) Merchant Road
21 Bram Ashford Duel (arranged) Pallid Crossroads
26 Adelaide Dunne Public execution Veinspire
30 Mira Alethain FAILED She killed him instead
Mira didn't even know they were murdered — she thought they had simply died to time and bad luck. Kaleth found this delicious.

Relationships

Seraphine Vale

Kaleth used Seraphine as a pawn, finding her earnest faith privately amusing. From his journal, he called her "the ideal instrument."

Seraphine believed Kaleth was a devoted servant of the Tribunal. She had no idea he was a cynical murderer who found her faith hilarious.

Mira Alethain

His final target. He killed her husband Elias by pushing him off a cliff, staged to look like an accident. He saved her for last, intending to extract information about the Arterial Texts before killing her.

Key Moments

Death in the Ossuary Chamber

Kaleth set a trap using Vela Thorne as bait, knowing Mira would come. He brought guards, a priest, a blood-crawler, and the Sanguine Siphon — a device to drain Mareathan divine power.

He activated it. Mira's crimson aura drained. She collapsed.

He thought he'd won.

What Kaleth didn't know: the red aura was borrowed power. Mira's true power — her Undying Conviction — was entirely her own.

She rose wreathed in orange-gold fire, speaking the names of her dead friends.

Four strikes:
  1. Shoulder through to below the arm — split him open
  2. Backswing — removed his other arm at the elbow
  3. Rising cut — sternum to throat
  4. Executioner's stroke — head removed
Time elapsed: Less than four seconds.

Items Found on Body

Standard:
  • Black iron keyring (7 keys)
  • 45 gold, 12 silver
  • Tribunal signet ring
  • Simple dagger
  • Vial of Obedience Draught
Hidden:
  • Sealed letter from "S" — mentions "The Cardinal," "The Confluence"
  • Journal — personal notes, cynicism, used Seraphine as pawn
  • Kill list — all seven heretics with names, dates, methods
  • Brass key — Pre-Usurpation symbol (door within a door), hidden in false tooth

Legacy

Kaleth Vorn murdered six people over thirty years. He used Seraphine Vale without her knowledge. He kept trophies and wrote about his victims with clinical detachment.

He died in pieces, unable to speak his final words, killed by the woman whose husband he pushed off a cliff.

The last thing he saw: Orange fire and the face of judgment.

items.title: Marn the Glasswright
items.content:
Marn the Glasswright

Overview

Bottler of Moments Location: The Clockwork Caravanserai marketplace Role: Merchant of vessels and temporal containers Status: Unknown (Caravanserai destroyed)

Marn operates a crooked stall at the far end of the Caravanserai's bazaar, selling vessels designed to contain moments, seconds, and temporal essence.

Appearance

A strange being with hands that are translucent — sand trickles constantly from her wrists into a small basin. Where her eyes should be are two hourglasses, turning slowly of their own accord.

Her stall is built from shattered timepieces.

Services

Marn sells vessels designed to contain moments, seconds, and temporal essence.

When Sol's coins hit her counter:

The coins crumbled into sand before hitting the basin.

"The simple flask remembers nothing. May you envy it."

Key Moments

The Warden's Core

When Jonas showed her the Warden's Core, the entire stall hummed. The glass counters rattled. The hourglasses in her eyes reversed direction.

She refused to buy it directly but directed them elsewhere:

"That... does not belong here. Seek the Echo Collector. Lower decks, near the sleeping cages. He buys what time cannot measure — voices, gods, cores."

"If you sell it, it will remember you."

items.title: Mira Alethain
items.content:
Mira Alethain

Overview

Mira was a two-thousand-year-old Sanctified Champion who witnessed the Usurpation itself. She served Mareatha for millennia before discovering the Sanguine Doctrine was a lie. As the last of the Seven Heretics, she was hunted for thirty years before being consumed by Savaros the High Keeper in the Catacomb Reliquary.

Appearance

Physical Appearance A weathered woman in her apparent fifties, though her true age stretched back before the Sovereigns' ascension — she witnessed the Usurpation itself. Grey-streaked dark hair pulled back severely. Sharp, assessing eyes that had seen too much death. Hands that healed but remembered how to kill. She moved with a healer's gentleness and a warrior's readiness — never quite one or the other.

A faded scar ran along her left forearm — a reminder of when she cut the Mareathan brand from her own flesh.

She always wore her wedding ring.

Personality

Core Traits:
  • Pragmatic survivor — two thousand years taught harsh lessons
  • Fierce protector — would die for those she considered hers
  • Unshakeable conviction — her faith in truth could not be broken
  • Controlled fury — millennia of grief compressed into cold purpose
  • Widow — she lost her husband to what she thought was bad luck; she learned it was murder
What She Wanted:
  1. Kill Kaleth Vorn — the Tribunal Hand who hunted the Seven ✓ COMPLETE
  2. Reunite with Elias — lay her bones beside her husband's ✓ COMPLETE (by the party)
  3. Protect the Arterial Texts — the truth must survive (location now lost)
  4. See the party survive — they reminded her why she kept fighting
What She Feared:
  • That she'd led four young people to their deaths (like the other six)
  • That the Texts would be destroyed and the truth would die with her
  • That she'd become the monster the Church already thought she was

Background

Before the Sovereigns

Mira was alive before the Usurpation — before the Thirteen murdered Aedwynn and claimed divine power. She witnessed the old world, walked under true divine light, and watched thirteen mortals butcher a god and reshape reality around their stolen organs.

When the Sovereigns ascended, Mira chose to serve Mareatha — believing the new order was necessary, or at least unavoidable. For over two millennia, she devoted herself to the Vein-Mother's church, rising to become one of its most skilled and respected healers. At a certain point of power and conviction, her aging simply... stopped. She willed herself to continue, and her body obeyed.

Her oath was simple: Truth. Justice. Protection of the Faithful.

The Discovery

Thirty years ago, Mira and six other priests discovered something that shattered her faith:

The Sanguine Doctrine was a lie.

Deep in the Arterial Archives, they found the Arterial Texts — Mareatha's own writings from before the Usurpation. Her mortal words. Her doubts. Her failures. Her uncertainty about whether killing Aedwynn was right.

The Texts proved:

  • Mareatha was fallible before divinity
  • The Sanguine Doctrine was written by mortals AFTER the Usurpation
  • The Church's foundation was political consolidation, not divine mandate
  • The Vein-Mother herself had questioned the murder of the Maker

The Seven Heretics

The seven priests who discovered this truth:

Name Role Fate
Aldric Sarne Theologian ☠️ Killed, Year 3
Elias Alethain Healer — Mira's husband ☠️ Killed, Year 8
Corwin Marsh Scholar ☠️ Killed, Year 12
Daven Holt Chronicler ☠️ Killed, Year 17
Bram Ashford Warrior-Priest ☠️ Killed, Year 21
Adelaide Dunne Seer ☠️ Killed, Year 26

They tried to reform the Church from within. They were branded heretics and hunted. They fled Veinspire and scattered. For thirty years, Mira believed they had simply disappeared — bad luck, dangerous roads. She didn't know the Tribunal had systematically murdered every single one of them.

Elias

Mira married Elias Alethain during their flight from Veinspire — finding love in the midst of being hunted. Despite her ancient age, she had never truly loved before him. She took his name.

In Year 8, Elias traveled near Verdant Pass. He never came back. Word reached Mira that he'd died in the mountain passes — a travel accident, they said. His body was never found.

The truth: Savaros the High Keeper found Elias and pushed him from a cliff. Elias crawled to a cave and eventually died there, alone. Talaris, impressed by his tenacity, refused to claim him — letting him die on his own terms in the Cave of Waiting.

For twenty-two years, Mira believed it was an accident. Then the Maker revealed the truth.

Thirty Years of Hiding

For three decades, Mira lived as "Mira Hemm" — a healer in Pallid Crossroads. She delivered children, buried parents, taught medicine to the next generation, and watched her friends disappear one by one (not knowing they were murdered).

She knew they would find her eventually. She just hoped to outlast them out of spite first.

Relationships

With the Party

Character Relationship
Sol Raven Recognized something ancient in him. "You're connected to something older than the Sovereigns. Be careful what that means."
Jonas Respected his directness, frustrated by his recklessness. "Defiance without wisdom gets people killed."
Fursen Gentle with him — recognized someone still adapting to freedom after imprisonment.
Kael Studied him longest. Knew what he was. Told him the truth even though it hurt.

With Antagonists

Character Relationship
Kaleth Vorn Primary target. She ended him. ✓
Seraphine Vale The child she delivered thirty-four years ago. "She's dangerous to you. Not to me."
Savaros The monster who killed her husband — and eventually killed her.

Seraphine Vale

Thirty-four years ago, Mira — still a devoted servant of Mareatha — delivered Seraphine Vale into the world. She blessed that child in Mareatha's name. Now that child hunts her as a heretic.

When Mira looked at Seraphine, she saw a victim of the same lies she once believed, a child raised without the chance to question. She didn't want to kill her — she wanted to save her.

What They Know

Ancient History:
  • Witnessed the Usurpation — watched the Thirteen murder Aedwynn
  • Knew the Sovereigns when they were mortal
  • Remembered the world before the Sovereigns reshaped it
About the Church:
  • The Sanguine Doctrine is fabricated
  • The Arterial Texts prove Mareatha's doubts
  • The Tribunal systematically murdered the Seven Heretics
About the Present:
  • Kaleth Vorn was a cynical murderer who found faith useful
  • Savaros was a Skin-Walker infiltrating the Church
  • The Cardinal is also a Skin-Walker, planted even earlier

Key Moments

First Encounter with the Party

The party first met Mira under her alias Mira Hemm at her clinic in the Pallid Crossroads. Jonas arrived bearing Imhuran's temporal brand on his chest — clock-hands still ticking, counting toward death.

Mira examined him, listened to his story about the 13-Hour Trial, about trying to intimidate a Sovereign. Then she called him what he was:

"You're an idiot. An arrogant, reckless idiot who's lucky to still have a heartbeat. But you're a lucky idiot, and that's something."

She lifted the curse. The mark stayed, but it wouldn't kill him anymore.

Undying Conviction — Killing Kaleth Vorn

When Kaleth Vorn's Sanguine Siphon drained Mira's crimson aura, he thought he'd won. What he didn't know: the red aura was borrowed power. Mira's true power — her Undying Conviction — was entirely her own.

She rose wreathed in orange-gold fire, speaking the names of her dead friends:

"Aldric. Elias. Corwin. Daven. Bram. Adelaide. I am still here."

Four strikes:
  1. Shoulder through to below the arm — split him open
  2. Backswing — removed his other arm at the elbow
  3. Rising cut — sternum to throat
  4. Executioner's stroke — head removed
Time elapsed: Less than four seconds.

Death in the Catacomb Reliquary

In the Catacomb Reliquary beneath Veinspire, Mira faced Savaros — the ancient Skin-Walker. Despite her power, three levels of exhaustion from triggering Undying Conviction left her vulnerable.

Her flesh was ripped from her bones.

Savaros consumed her flesh, adding her to his collection of stolen identities. Her skeleton collapsed to the cold stone floor. Her wedding ring remained in the gore. Sol Raven retrieved it.

Two thousand years of conviction. Thirty years of hiding. Six friends murdered. A husband she never got to bury. It ended on cold stone in a monster's lair.

Final Rest

Reunited at Last Location: The Cave of Waiting, Verdant Pass Completed by: Jonas, Sol Raven, Fursen

The party carried Mira's remains through the Blooming Rot. In the Cave of Waiting, they found Elias Alethain — his skeleton pristine after twenty-two years in the one place Talaris cannot reach.

Fursen laid Mira's bones beside her husband. Sol placed her wedding ring on her finger and moved her hand until her fingers rested against Elias's.

🦁 "I am sorry we could not reunite you in life. But at least in death, we have brought you together."

— Fursen

Two skeletons now rest in the Cave of Waiting, holding hands in a place where nothing rots.

The Two Auras

Mareathan Power vs True Conviction

Mira carried two sources of power, visible as two distinct auras.

The Red Aura (Mareathan Divine Power)

Despite breaking her oath to the Church, Mira retained divine power from her two millennia of service to Mareatha. This manifested as a crimson aura. Near Mareathan holy sites, she blazed with crimson light visible to mundane sight. Could be drained by Tribunal artifacts like the Sanguine Siphon.

The Orange Aura (Undying Conviction)

Mira's true power — her Undying Conviction — had nothing to do with Mareatha or any Sovereign. It was entirely hers, forged from two thousand years of refusing to break, thirty years of grief compressed into purpose, six names burned into her soul, and love that outlasted death and betrayal.

This manifested as an orange-gold glow — warm like sunrise, terrible like wildfire. Could not be drained, suppressed, or stolen by any divine artifact.

Legacy

"Aldric. Elias. Corwin. Daven. Bram. Adelaide."

Now add one more name to the litany:

Mira.

The Seven Heretics are all dead.

The party carries her bones, her ring. They remember.

She died fighting beside people she'd known for less than a week, in a hole beneath a church that had hunted her for thirty years, trying to stop a conspiracy she'd only begun to understand.

She died as she lived: refusing to run.

The Bleeding Blade remembers her. It felt her die.

Quotes

"Aldric. Elias. Corwin. Daven. Bram. Adelaide. I am still here."

"I broke my oath to an institution. I never broke my oath to what mattered."

"Down here, pride is a luxury. Precision keeps you alive."

"Twenty-two years. I thought Elias died to a mountain road. Twenty-two years."

"I watched them kill the Maker. I watched them build their churches on his corpse. I served them for two thousand years. And they lied about all of it."

Undying Conviction

items.title: Savaros the High Keeper
items.content:
Savaros, the High Keeper

Overview

He consumed Mira Alethain and Kael in the Catacomb Reliquary — but Kael was an ontological anomaly that even Vor'Kael couldn't digest. Savaros died from poisoning himself.

Appearance

Physical Appearance The figure wears robes the color of arterial spray. A mask shaped like Mareatha's weeping visage covers his face — tears of blood frozen in crimson metal. His hands are gloved. No skin is visible.

When he speaks, his voice sounds like paper tearing — dozens of voices layered atop one another, never quite synchronizing. Sometimes a woman's tone bleeds through. Sometimes a child's.

He moves wrong. Not inhumanly fast or slow, but layered — as if multiple people are trying to walk using the same legs, compromising on each step.

The mask has no eye holes. He doesn't need them.

Personality

  • Patient — fifteen centuries of waiting; a few more hours means nothing
  • Methodical — every action serves a purpose; nothing is wasted
  • Curious — genuinely interested in identities, secrets, what makes people them
  • Cruel — not sadistically, but practically; suffering extracts information
What He Wanted:
  1. Protect the Cardinal — his superior must not be exposed
  2. Consume interesting identities — he collected them like others collect art
  3. Survive — he's existed for fifteen centuries; he intended to exist for fifteen more
What He Feared:
  • Mirrors — they reveal his void form; he removed all from the Reliquary
  • Exposure — if the Church learned what he was, the infiltration would end
  • True self-examination — like all Skin-Walkers, he avoided confronting his own emptiness

Background

Origin

What he remembered: the mission.

Fifteen centuries later, he was the High Keeper of the Catacomb Reliquary — guardian of the Church's most sacred relics and darkest secrets.

The Infiltration

  • Secrets extracted from confessions
  • Identities of potential targets
  • Church politics and power structures
  • The location of relics and artifacts
  • Weaknesses in Mareatha's domain

Mareatha remained unaware. She sleeps, subconsciously blessing her followers, dismissing the mortal bureaucracy as "uninteresting." As long as offerings flow and her domain expands, she doesn't look closely at who runs her Church.

Relationship with Kaleth Vorn

Kaleth Vorn reported to Savaros — believing him to be a high-ranking Church official, nothing more. Savaros provided:

  • Intelligence on the Seven Heretics' locations
  • Orders from "the Tribunal"

Kaleth never knew his handler was a monster wearing stolen faces. He was a useful tool — fanatical, competent, disposable.

Relationships

Character Relationship
Kaleth Vorn Tool — provided with resources and targets
Mira Alethain Target — consumed her in the Reliquary
Kael Death — his indigestible flesh killed Savaros
Elias Alethain Victim — pushed him off a cliff 22 years ago

What They Know

About the Church:
  • Every secret the Church has kept for fifteen centuries
  • The Cardinal's true nature
  • Where relics are stored and why
  • Weaknesses in Mareatha's domain
Intelligence on Party (from Kaleth):
  • They killed Kaleth
  • They travel with Mira Alethain
  • They carry unusual artifacts

Key Moments

The Battle

The party descended through the Arterial Passage and confronted Savaros in the main chamber of the Catacomb Reliquary.

What Savaros Achieved Before Death:
  • Consumed Mira Alethain's flesh and skin — ripped from her bones
  • Consumed Kael's flesh and skin — torn from his skeleton

Death — Poetic Justice

After consuming Mira, Savaros turned his hunger on Kael. He ripped away Kael's flesh and skin, reducing him to a skeleton with a cracked ribcage.

But Kael was no ordinary being.

Kael was an ontological anomaly — a concept that Vor'Kael the Hollow Empress herself had tried to digest and couldn't. She vomited him out because his very nature was indigestible, incompatible with consumption.

When Savaros tried to digest Kael's flesh, the same thing happened.

He began to convulse.

The stolen faces beneath his robes contorted in agony. His paper-tearing voice became a shriek of a hundred identities screaming at once. His form shuddered, spasmed, and began to unravel — not from the party's assault, but from the poison he had willingly consumed.

Kael's flesh was toxic to any entity that tried to incorporate it. What Vor'Kael — a Sovereign — couldn't stomach, a mere Skin-Walker had no hope of surviving.

His robes collapsed around emptiness. His mask — Brother Aldric's death mask — clattered to the stone.

Fifteen hundred years of infiltration. Hundreds of stolen identities. A network that reached to the highest levels of Mareatha's Church.

Ended by consuming something that refused to be consumed. The concept that wouldn't die... killed the monster that tried to eat it.

Fifteen centuries of faithful service earned Savaros considerable investment from the Obsidian Shepherd:

Blessing Description
Fear Harvest When a creature within 60 ft. became frightened, Savaros regained 15 HP.
Reflection's Revenge When hit by a melee attack, could force the attacker to see themselves delivering the blow and take half the damage as psychic.
Boundary Slip Once per day, could move through solid objects for 1 minute.

Aftermath

With Savaros Dead

  • The Cardinal knows something went wrong when Savaros doesn't report
  • The party can search the Reliquary for intelligence
  • The Confluence continued, but with increased security

Quotes

"You killed Kaleth." (A woman's voice underneath, grieving.)

"He was useful." (A child's voice, petulant.)

"You are less so." (His own voice — if he ever had one — cold as a void.)

"I have worn priests. I have worn paladins. I have worn saints." (A chorus of the faithful.)

"Do you know how many heretics I have consumed in this very chamber?" (Screaming, underneath.)

items.title: Sekris
items.content:
Sekris

Overview

Sekris is a meaning-dealer who trades in concepts, identities, and purposes. He gave Fursen a contract-token that could be used to arrange Jonas's removal.

Appearance

Sekris's appearance shifts constantly:

  • Face: Never the same twice — features slide between configurations
  • Voice: Smooth, persuasive, always knowing exactly what to say
  • Eyes: The only constant — pale and calculating, like someone weighing your worth
  • Clothing: Grey robes that seem to absorb light
  • Presence: Makes you feel like a transaction waiting to happen

Personality

  • Sees everything as a transaction
  • Patient — willing to wait for the right moment to collect
  • Neither good nor evil — purely transactional
  • Cannot resist a truly valuable meaning
  • Bound by his own contracts — he MUST honor deals

Background

Sekris operates in Vor'Kael's border territories but is not her servant. He's a parasite on her economy — profiting from the meaning trade that her domain enables.

  • She tolerates him because he's useful
  • He provides her with meanings to consume
  • He cleans up after her — helps people cope with meaning-loss
  • He's careful never to become interesting enough for her to eat

What They Know

As a Meaning-Dealer, Sekris Can:
  • Buy and sell meanings (identities, purposes, relationships, emotions)
  • Remove a person's significance (make them "not matter")
  • Transfer meanings between people or objects
  • Arrange for concepts to be consumed by Vor'Kael's servants
  • Provide protection from meaning-loss in exchange for payment
Currency:
  • Meanings, not gold
  • A treasured memory, a strong emotion, a sense of purpose
  • Sometimes more conventional payment if the meaning attached is valuable

Services

Service Typical Cost
Remove a traumatic memory A treasured memory in exchange
Sever a painful relationship The capacity to form new close bonds for 1 year
Transfer a curse to another The original victim's forgiveness
Make someone "not matter" The client's sense of purpose
Information about the Devoured Courts A secret the client has never told anyone
The costs are always meanings, not gold. And they always hurt more than expected.

Key Moments

The Contract-Token

At the Last Hearth Tavern in Lastwell, Sekris approached Fursen after watching the conflict between Fursen and Jonas.

What Sekris Observed:
  • Jonas stabbed Fursen twice
  • Trust broken between companions
  • Fursen angry, wounded, resentful
The Offer: Sekris gave Fursen a contract-token — a smoke-grey coin that shifts between faces.

"If you ever need something... removed. A meaning you no longer want in your life. Break the coin. I'll find you."

The Implication:
  • Sekris can "remove" Jonas's meaning
  • This could mean: making Jonas "not matter," erasing him, or arranging his death
  • The deal is not yet made — only the option exists
  • Breaking the coin summons Sekris to negotiate terms
Current Holder: Fursen What Breaking It Would Do:
  1. Summon Sekris regardless of location
  2. Open negotiations for a "removal"
  3. Require payment in meaning (not gold)
  4. Bind both parties to the terms agreed upon

Quotes

"If you ever need something... removed. A meaning you no longer want in your life. Break the coin. I'll find you."

"In the Devoured Courts, everything is currency. Memories. Emotions. Relationships. Names. Some people pay with gold. The smart ones pay with things they won't miss... until they do."

"The best transactions are the ones where both parties think they got the better deal. At least until the invoice comes due."

items.title: Seraphine Vale
items.content:
Seraphine Vale

Overview

Seraphine Vale was the youngest High Inquisitor in three centuries — a true believer who had never experienced doubt. Thirty-four years ago, Mira Alethain delivered her into the world. Now, after learning that Kaleth Vorn called her "the ideal instrument" and that her faith was built on lies, she carries Mira's legendary sword and flees toward an uncertain future.

Appearance

Physical Appearance A striking woman in her mid-thirties with sharp features and eyes the color of dried blood — a mark of Mareatha's favor. Her dark hair is worn in a severe braid, and she carries herself with the absolute certainty of someone who has never questioned their purpose. Her Inquisitor's vestments are immaculate white trimmed with arterial red, and she wears the holy symbol of Mareatha openly at her throat.

There is no cruelty in her face. That's what makes her dangerous. She genuinely believes she is saving souls.

Mira Alethain remembers when those blood-colored eyes were just a child's brown. Before the Church got to her.

Personality

Core Traits (Before Shattering):
  • True believer — had never experienced genuine doubt
  • Righteous certainty — knew she was doing holy work
  • Patient predator — preferred to study prey before striking
  • Silver-tongued — turned interrogations into theological debates
  • Incorruptible — could not be bribed, seduced, or swayed
After Faith Shattered:
  • Uncertain — everything she believed was a lie
  • Betrayed — fourteen years of service, and she was just "an instrument"
  • Seeking — needs new meaning, new purpose
  • Armed — carries Oathkeeper, a blade forged to cut through lies

Background

The Vale Family

The Vale family has served the Mareathan Church for six generations. Faithful. Devout. Unquestioning. Seraphine's mother died in service to the Vein-Mother when Seraphine was seven.

And Mira Alethain delivered Seraphine into the world.

Thirty-four years ago, before Mira fled Veinspire, before she became "Mira Hemm" — she was one of the Church's most skilled healers. She attended Seraphine's mother through a difficult birth. She blessed the child in Mareatha's name.

Now that infant hunts her as a heretic.

The Perfect Servant

Seraphine was raised in the Church after her mother's death. The clergy became her family. The Sanguine Doctrine became her truth. She never had a chance to question — the faith was woven into her bones before she could walk.

At thirty-four, she became the youngest High Inquisitor in three centuries. The Church celebrated her as proof that faith conquers all.

Mira saw her as proof that the Church devours its children.

What She Discovered

When Mira and Sol confronted her at the Church of the Merciful Vein:

  • Mira revealed she killed Kaleth Vorn
  • Mira revealed she delivered Seraphine thirty-four years ago
  • Sol told her she'd been indoctrinated her entire life

They showed her Kaleth's journal and letters:

  • Kill list with six crossed-out names
  • Journal entry calling Seraphine "the ideal instrument"
  • Kaleth's admission he didn't believe any of the doctrine
  • Evidence of his murders spanning thirty years

Her response to learning Kaleth was dead: "Good."

Relationships

With Mira Alethain

What Seraphine Knew What Seraphine Didn't Know
Mira Alethain was the last of the Seven Heretics Mira delivered her when she was born
She was once a respected healer before her fall Mira is over two thousand years old
Capturing her would be legendary Mira could kill her without effort
Mira didn't want to kill her — she wanted to save her

When Mira looked at Seraphine, she didn't see an enemy. She saw a victim of the same lies she once believed, a child raised without the chance to question.

With Kaleth Vorn

Seraphine believed Kaleth was a devoted servant of the Tribunal. She had no idea he was a cynical murderer who found her faith amusing.

From Kaleth's journal, he called her "the ideal instrument."

"He called me an instrument. Fourteen years of service, and that's what I was to him. A tool."

With the Party

Character Relationship
Sol Raven Gave her Oathkeeper — believed she needed something to hold onto
Mira Alethain The woman who delivered her and shattered her faith
Kael Buried behind her church

What They Know

About the Church:
  • Kaleth Vorn didn't believe any of the doctrine
  • Kaleth systematically murdered the Seven Heretics over thirty years
  • She was used as an "instrument" — never a partner
  • The Church may be built on lies
Intelligence Provided to the Party:
  • Savaros — High Keeper of the Catacomb Reliquary, Kaleth's superior
  • The Cardinal — Position above Savaros, may not be human, ordered the hunt for the Seven
  • The Confluence — Ritual at the new moon, days away, Kaleth feared it
  • The Martyr's Gauntlet — Cathedral vault is empty; may be with Savaros

Key Moments

The Confrontation

Seraphine waited at the Church of the Merciful Vein as ordered by Kaleth Vorn. When Mira and Sol approached, she was prepared to capture the legendary last member of the Seven.

Instead, Mira stepped forward and spoke the truth:

"I delivered you. Did you know that? Thirty-four years ago. Your mother was afraid — the birth was difficult. But you were strong. You cried so loud the priests in the next chamber heard you."

Faith Shattering

After seeing Kaleth's journal — his contempt for the faith she'd devoted her life to, his use of her as a tool — Seraphine's certainty cracked.

She dismissed the guards with a false report, kenneled the Blood-Hound, and set aside the Obedience Draught she was supposed to use on Mira.

The Confluence

Seraphine witnessed the Confluence — the resurrection of Ardian Bloodveil, the legendary First Templar.

She sensed something was deeply wrong.

Whether Oathkeeper warned her, or her shattered faith made her sensitive to deception — Seraphine recognized that the "returned hero" was not what he appeared to be.

Flight from Veinspire

After the Confluence, Seraphine:

  • Renounced her faith entirely — not just doubt, but complete rejection
  • Left a hidden letter in her old room at the Church of the Merciful Vein
  • Fled with Vela Thorne — the rescued archivist who also has no place in the Church
  • Took Oathkeeper with her
  • Heading to Crownfall — Unclaimed territory, outside Sovereign control

Oathkeeper

After the events in the Catacomb Reliquary, Sol Raven gave Seraphine Oathkeeper — Mira Alethain's legendary greatsword.

The blade that served a two-thousand-year-old saint now rests in the hands of a thirty-four-year-old woman whose faith just shattered.

Why Sol gave it to her: Sol believed Seraphine needed something to hold onto — something that represented conviction and purpose. Mira's blade, forged to cut through lies, seemed fitting for someone who just learned her entire life was built on them. She carries Oathkeeper now — a blade forged to cut through lies, given to a woman who just learned her entire life was one.

The Letter

Seraphine left a hidden letter in her old room at the Church of the Merciful Vein. Its contents include:

  • Her suspicions about Ardian Bloodveil
  • Warning that something is wrong with the "returned" First Templar
  • Her renunciation of the Mareathan faith
  • Where she might be going

The party hasn't found it yet. They were in the Throat of Forgotten Things. Their contact has vanished. Only the letter remains.

Quotes

"I don't hate heretics. I pity them. They've lost their way, and it falls to us to guide them back — or grant them the mercy of ending their suffering." — Before

"He called me an instrument. Fourteen years of service, and that's what I was to him. A tool." — After

"Good." — Her response to learning Kaleth was dead
items.raw: Seraphine Vale Overview Seraphine Vale was the youngest High Inquisitor in three centuries — a true believer who had never experienced doubt. Thirty-four years ago, Mira Alethain delivered her into the world. Now, after learning that Kaleth Vorn called her "the ideal instrument" and that her faith was built on lies, she carries Mira's legendary sword and flees toward an uncertain future. Appearance Physical Appearance A striking woman in her mid-thirties with sharp features and eyes the color of dried blood — a mark of Mareatha's favor. Her dark hair is worn in a severe braid, and she carries herself with the absolute certainty of someone who has never questioned their purpose. Her Inquisitor's vestments are immaculate white trimmed with arterial red, and she wears the holy symbol of Mareatha openly at her throat. There is no cruelty in her face. That's what makes her dangerous. She genuinely believes she is saving souls. Mira Alethain remembers when those blood-colored eyes were just a child's brown. Before the Church got to her. Personality Core Traits (Before Shattering): True believer — had never experienced genuine doubt Righteous certainty — knew she was doing holy work Patient predator — preferred to study prey before striking Silver-tongued — turned interrogations into theological debates Incorruptible — could not be bribed, seduced, or swayed After Faith Shattered: Uncertain — everything she believed was a lie Betrayed — fourteen years of service, and she was just "an instrument" Seeking — needs new meaning, new purpose Armed — carries Oathkeeper, a blade forged to cut through lies Background The Vale Family The Vale family has served the Mareathan Church for six generations. Faithful. Devout. Unquestioning. Seraphine's mother died in service to the Vein-Mother when Seraphine was seven. And Mira Alethain delivered Seraphine into the world. items.title: The Cardinal
items.content:
The Cardinal

Overview

The Cardinal is the mysterious power behind the Tribunal of the Sanguine Doctrine. No one knows their true identity or nature — only that their authority is absolute.

Appearance

Unknown. The Cardinal operates through intermediaries and written orders. Their physical form — if they have one — has never been reliably described.

Personality

According to Thessaly:

"The Cardinal isn't like Kaleth. Kaleth was a blade — pointed, direct, predictable. The Cardinal is a web. You won't see the threads until you're already tangled."

Background

What Is Known

From Seraphine Vale:

"I don't know who the Cardinal is. No one does. Not even Savaros, I think."

"The Cardinal isn't a person — it's a position. A title. Someone who speaks for... something higher."

Authority:

"Every major decision goes through the Cardinal. Every purge. Every doctrinal revision. Every execution order for high-value targets."

"The order to hunt the Seven Heretics. That came from the Cardinal. Thirty years ago."

Nature:

"I've heard rumors that the Cardinal isn't human. That they haven't been human for a very long time. But rumors are cheap in Veinspire."

Theories

What the Cardinal might be:

  1. An ancient human — preserved through divine means
  2. A Sovereign fragment — a piece of Mareatha's consciousness
  3. Something older — predating even the Usurpation
  4. A position, not a being — occupied by different entities over time
  5. The true voice of Mareatha — speaking through a vessel

What They Know

The Cardinal has access to:

  • All Tribunal intelligence and operations
  • Doctrinal authority over Church teachings
  • Communication channels with unknown entities
  • Historical records the Church has supposedly destroyed

Key Moments

The Seven Heretics

The Cardinal ordered the hunt for the Seven thirty years ago:

  • Targeted Mira Alethain and her companions
  • Assigned Kaleth Vorn as the weapon
  • Six of seven successfully killed over thirty years
  • Mira was the last survivor

The Confluence

The Cardinal orchestrated the Confluence — a resurrection ritual that brought back Ardian Bloodveil, the legendary First Templar.

A letter from the Cardinal was found in Ardian's quarters, requesting a private meeting.

Doctrinal Control

Every major doctrinal revision passes through the Cardinal. They shape what the Church believes — deciding which truths become heresy and which lies become doctrine.

items.title: The Satiated One
items.content:
The Satiated One

Overview

The Perfectly Content Status: Active (Ancient Primordial Entity) Affiliation: None (predates the Sovereigns) Location: The Obstruction, within the Throat of Forgotten Things

An ancient serpentine being older than the Sovereigns, perfectly content, lodged in Vor'Kael's throat for 800 years because she cannot digest something with no hunger.

Appearance

A vast serpentine being filling most of the chamber where it rests. Coils wrap in patterns that hurt to follow — loops within loops, perfect stillness geometry.

  • Scales: Shimmer between nameless colors (not-black, not-silver, not-anything)
  • Eyes: Twin pale luminous moons, utterly calm
  • Expression: None, but radiates CONTENTMENT
  • Size: Fills the obstruction chamber, blocking the entire passage

Personality

The Satiated One is perfectly content. Not happy, not pleased — simply complete. It wants nothing, needs nothing, craves nothing. It is a being that has achieved absolute stillness.

"Hunger and satisfaction are not opposites. They are CHOICES. She chose hunger. I chose stillness."

Background

"I was here before the Hungry One. Before the Usurpation. Before the Thirteen carved up the Maker and wore its organs like crowns."

Origin:
  • Predates the Sovereigns
  • Watched the Maker die
  • Was "passing through" when Aedwynn was murdered
  • Found the corpse "warm, comfortable" and stopped to rest
Encounter with Vor'Kael:
  • When Vor'Kael took the stomach, she found the Satiated One already sleeping inside
  • She tried to digest it for years, decades, centuries
  • But it has no meaning to dissolve — it simply IS
  • Eventually she stopped trying
  • It became "furniture" — an obstruction she learned to ignore
Why Vor'Kael Cannot Digest It:
  • Vor'Kael's digestive engine consumes meaning
  • The Satiated One has no purpose to consume, no meaning to digest
  • It simply IS, without wanting to be anything else
  • Satisfaction cannot be consumed — there's nothing to take

What They Know

The Satiated One remembers the world before the Sovereigns. It can answer questions about Pre-Usurpation history with perfect accuracy. It watched the Thirteen murder Aedwynn. It knows their mortal names, their mortal fears, their mortal weaknesses. Whether it shares this information depends entirely on whether the question is... interesting.

Philosophy

On Time:

"I do not count time. Time is for those who wait for something. I wait for nothing."

On Staying:

"Where would I go? I have seen the world above. I have swum through the spaces between stars. There is nothing I have not seen. Nothing I have not done. Nothing I want to see or do."

On Vor'Kael's Rage:

"There is a certain... amusement... in being the one thing she cannot have. The meal she cannot finish."

On Hunger vs. Stillness:

"Hunger and satisfaction are not opposites. They are CHOICES. She chose hunger. I chose stillness. What will you choose?"

On Lost People:

"I had a people once. Long ago. Before I learned to be still. They are gone now. I do not mourn them. I do not miss them. I simply... remember. Without pain. Without longing."

Key Moments

The Party's Encounter

Why It Let Them Pass:

Jonas spoke Vor'Kael's true name aloud to demand passage. The Satiated One found this "interesting" — the first interesting thing in 800 years.

"I have not found anything interesting in... very long time."

It moved for the first time in centuries — not because of Vor'Kael's promise, not because Jonas demanded it, but because it wanted to see what happens next.

"I will let you pass. Not because she commands, not because you demand. But because I wish to see what happens next."

To Jonas

"She will not forgive this. You understand that, yes? Every time you speak that name, you remind her of what she destroyed. What she lost."

To Fursen

The Satiated One spoke directly to Fursen about the 10,000 names he carries:

"You carry the erased, little cat. I can smell them on you. Names that were unmade. Lives that were forgotten. They are not satisfied. They want. They want to be remembered. To be avenged. To matter."

"That is why you keep moving. Why you cannot rest. Their hunger drives you forward."

"Perhaps one day, when your erased ones are avenged or released or simply done... you will find your own stillness. Or perhaps you will become like her. Hungry forever. Never full."

Effect on the Party

  • Fursen's 10,000 names went SILENT — not afraid, just quiet before something so old
  • Sol's unlived lives stopped whispering — first silence since the Door of Possibility
  • Jonas's brand pulsed once — Azerach acknowledges/respects this thing

Significance

The Satiated One represents the philosophical opposite of Vor'Kael:

Vor'Kael The Satiated One
Eternal hunger Eternal contentment
Consumes to fill emptiness Has no emptiness to fill
Cannot stop Has no need to move
Remembers with pain Remembers without pain
Chose MORE Chose ENOUGH

It proves that Vor'Kael's curse is not inevitable — satisfaction IS possible. She simply chose hunger when she took the Digestive Engine.

items.title: Thessaly
items.content:
Thessaly

Overview

The Keeper of Forbidden Knowledge Profession: Bookseller (Official), Dealer in Forbidden Texts (Actual) Location: The Frayed Codex, Lesser Sacral District, Veinspire Role: Information Source, Rare Text Dealer

Thessaly runs The Frayed Codex, a narrow bookshop that deals in far more than hymnals and devotional texts. She is one of the most knowledgeable beings in Veinspire about forbidden history.

Appearance

Old. Impossibly old. Skin like crumpled parchment, hair like white cobwebs, fingers like bundled twigs. Wears spectacles with lenses so thick they magnify her eyes to unsettling proportions.

Despite her frail appearance, she moves through her maze of books with the certainty of someone who knows exactly where everything is.

The Frayed Codex: A narrow shopfront between a chandler and a boarded-up residence. Sign barely legible — faded paint depicting an open book with curling pages. Inside: larger than it looks. Every surface covered in books, scrolls, and papers. Stacks reaching to the ceiling. The door bell has no clapper — removed intentionally. Smells of old paper, older ink, and dried lavender hanging from the rafters.

Personality

  • Patient with seekers of knowledge
  • Irreverent toward age and status (calls 2000-year-old Mira "girl")
  • Values truth over comfort
  • Protects dangerous knowledge rather than destroying it
  • Has grown weary of immortality — letting herself age now

Background

Thessaly is over 2000 years old. For centuries she used de-aging effects available to high-level characters in this world. She has now deactivated this — she's decided enough is enough and is letting herself age naturally.

She has spent her impossibly long life collecting forbidden knowledge. Pre-Usurpation fragments, restricted texts, documents the Church tried to destroy. Her obsession is the truth that has been erased.

Relationships

Mira Alethain

Thessaly knew Mira before she fled Veinspire thirty years ago. She recognized her immediately:

"You look tired. And you've lost something. The red light you used to carry. Finally stopped pretending to be one of them?"

Fursen

She gave Fursen the Ledger of Moments for free — proof that a living Leonin existed was worth more than gold.

"I've spent my whole life collecting forbidden knowledge. The truth of the Leonin extinction is the one thing I've never been able to find."

What They Know

About the Resonant Codex

"That book is a Resonant Codex. There are perhaps four in existence. They don't get 'found' — they choose."

"It's quiet now. Content. I've never seen one content before."

About the Cardinal

"The Cardinal isn't like Kaleth. Kaleth was a blade — pointed, direct, predictable. The Cardinal is a web. You won't see the threads until you're already tangled."

About Ardian's Items

"That's not a Skin-Walker's kit. That's a vessel's."

"The Confluence wasn't a resurrection. It was an insertion. They didn't bring Ardian Bloodveil back. They built a shell and put something else inside."

About Azerach Pacts

"He doesn't want blood. Doesn't want souls. He wants secrets. Yours. Others'. The things people bury so deep they forget they buried them."

"Warlocks of the Whispered King... they start to fade. People forget they're in the room. Conversations move past them. They become... background."

Services

Books Available

The Doctrine of Still Air (75 gp) — Purchased by Sol
  • Azerach's philosophy of silence
  • The nature of his brand (a door that opens both ways)
  • The Litany of Unmaking (forces truth for 1 hour, costs speaker's voice for 1 day)
The Unfinished Meal (100 gp) — Not Purchased
  • Meditation on being consumed by Vor'Kael
  • Pages blank until looked at, words dissolving when you try to read them
  • Shows what the Empress would find delicious about YOU
The Ledger of Moments (FREE) — Given to Fursen
  • Partial transcription of Imhuran's temporal records
  • Contains Leonin history — including Fursen's mother Vaelith
  • Updates itself — new names appear, old names vanish

Key Moments

First Visit

The party visited Thessaly at the Frayed Codex in Veinspire. Mira recognized the shop. Thessaly recognized Mira.

She sold Sol the Doctrine of Still Air, gave Fursen the Ledger of Moments, and warned them about the Cardinal.

Second Visit — Deaths Reported

The party informed Thessaly that Mira and Kael were killed by Savaros (Skin-Walker) in the Catacomb Reliquary.

Thessaly's reaction:

"Two thousand years. Two thousand years she survived. And a Skin-Walker..."

"How many Leonin are even left in the world?... You. Walking around Veinspire. Not exactly inconspicuous."

items.title: Vela Thorne
items.content:
Vela Thorne

Overview

The Rescued Archivist Status: Fled Veinspire Former Position: Junior Archivist, Mareathan Church Location: En route to Crownfall with Seraphine Vale

Vela Thorne was a junior archivist who discovered Kaleth Vorn's kill list. Captured and used as bait, she was rescued by the party and witnessed Mira's Undying Conviction.

Appearance

A young woman in her late twenties or early thirties — hard to tell under the bruises. Her robes were once the white-and-crimson of a Mareathan initiate, but they're torn now, stained with blood and tunnel-filth. Pale grey eyes, bloodshot from weeks of captivity. Dark circles beneath them. Hands that tremble when she's not actively using them.

She moves like someone who expects to be hit.

Personality

  • Traumatized — weeks of torture leave marks
  • Intelligent — still an archivist at heart, still curious
  • Fragile — flinches at sudden movements, doesn't sleep well
  • Determined — refuses to be useless
  • Awed — has seen things that reshape worldviews

Background

The Discovery

Vela was a junior archivist in the Mareathan Church — low-ranking, unremarkable, invisible. Until she found Kaleth Vorn's manifest.

A list of names spanning thirty years. All labeled "Resolved — Tribunal Authority." She started matching them to death records. Accident reports. Travel incidents.

None of them were accidents.

Capture

Kaleth caught her with the manifest. Instead of killing her, he smiled. Asked what she thought she'd found. Asked if she understood what heresy really meant.

Then he used her as bait.

"He said I'd make good bait. That the last name on his list would come for me eventually. That heretics can't resist saving people."

She was tortured. Questioned. Bound with blood-treated manacles. Kept barely alive for weeks, waiting for Mira Alethain to come.

Rescue

The party killed her captors and freed her. She witnessed Mira's Undying Conviction — watched a woman wreathed in orange fire dismember nine people in under a minute.

Relationships

Character Relationship
Mira Alethain Awe and terror. Watched her kill nine people. Also watched her weep for her husband.
Fursen Provided answers about his people. Respects his composure.
Jonas Cautious. He's branded by a Sovereign.
Sol Raven Unsettled. He's undead. But he was kind.
Seraphine Vale Traveling companion. Both fled the Church.

What They Know

  • The catacombs beneath Veinspire — layout, sealed areas, hidden passages
  • Pre-Usurpation history — more than most archivists
  • The Leonin extinction — unofficial version
  • The sealed vaults — where they are, why the Church couldn't open them
  • Kaleth Vorn's methods — firsthand experience

Key Moments

The Skin-Walker's Feast

  • Rescued from Tribunal guards
  • Provided information about Kaleth's trap
  • Explained Leonin history to Fursen
  • Led party to sealed pre-Usurpation vault
  • Witnessed the Chamber of the Final Breath

Departure

Fled Veinspire with Seraphine Vale, heading to Crownfall.

Quotes

"They say a lot of things." — On Church doctrine about heretics

"I don't have anywhere else to go now anyway." — On joining the party

"The official histories say the Leonin crime was 'defying divine authority.' But I think the real crime was simpler. You remembered the truth. And that terrified him." — To Fursen

items.title: Velara Ashyn
items.content:
Velara Ashyn

Overview

Velara Ashyn was once Kaedris's favorite — her consort, her lover. She stole the original passion-seed to prevent Kaedris from burning the world. She's been trapped in a soul anchor amulet for five hundred years, waiting.

Appearance

Velara's physical form is long dead. Her soul persists in the Soul Anchor Amulet:

  • Dull metal, tarnished green
  • Pulses with a heartbeat rhythm
  • Grows cold when approaching the Bastion's influence

Personality

  • Grateful — to finally be found after 500 years
  • Terrified — of returning to the Bastion
  • Desperate — to reach Crownfall and the Docent
  • Exhausted — after 500 years of imprisonment
  • Hopeful — for the first time in centuries

Background

Kaedris's Consort

Velara lived in the Heartspire at the center of the Bastion of Fireblood. She loved Kaedris. And Kaedris loved her — as much as something like the Sovereign of Passion can love.

But Velara saw what Kaedris was becoming. What she wanted to become.

The Discovery

Kaedris found a way to amplify her power — to make the whole world feel as she does. She began breeding passion-seeds, fragments of concentrated emotion harvested from Aedwynn's heart.

One seed can ignite a city. A hundred could burn the world.

The Theft

Velara stole the original — the first passion-seed, the one Kaedris cut from Aedwynn's heart with her own hands. Without it, the others are just echoes. With it, Kaedris could finish what she started.

Velara ran. Five hundred years ago.

The Flight

Velara hired the Morrow Trading Company to take her far from the Bastion. Her contract specified no stops in Sovereign-controlled territory.

Kaedris sent something to retrieve what was stolen. A shape in the heat shimmer. A woman — or something wearing a woman's shape. Beautiful. Burning. Feet that left glass in the dirt.

She found the caravan in the Unclaimed. Everyone burned from the inside out. Velara was already dead when the burning woman arrived. The soul anchor amulet preserved her consciousness.

She's been trapped ever since. Five hundred years. Watching the caravan rot. Waiting.

Relationships

Character Relationship
Kaedris Former lover — stolen from, now hunted by
Sol Raven Current holder of her amulet — can communicate with her
The Party Found her in the Bone Field

What They Know

About Kaedris:
  • Former mortal: A poet. A lover. Felt things so deeply the world couldn't contain them.
  • Claimed Aedwynn's heart during the Usurpation
  • The Bastion isn't a place — it's literally her heart
  • She feels everything that enters her domain
  • She's been looking for the passion-seed for 500 years
About the Passion-Seed:
  • A fragment of Aedwynn's heart, crystallized emotion
  • Kaedris can grow them — breed them
  • One seed can ignite a city
  • A hundred could burn the world
  • The original (which Velara stole) is the template — without it, the others are echoes
  • Cannot be destroyed — fire, blade, magic, nothing works
  • It responds to emotion, amplifies it
  • Don't feel strongly near it

Key Moments

Discovery in the Bone Field

The party found Velara in the Bone Field — a valley containing hundreds of skeletons (the Morrow caravan and its guards).

First Contact:
  • Jonas lifted the amulet; the corpse grabbed his wrist
  • "...don't... take it... to... her..."
  • The body crumbled to dust
Sol's Communion:
  • Sol communicated with the trapped soul
  • Learned her identity, her history, her request
  • She recognized Sol isn't alive but isn't empty: "...there's something inside you too..."

Her Reaction to the Party's Destination

When told they're heading to the Bastion of Fireblood, Velara recoiled. Terror. Desperation.

"...she'll feel me the moment I cross the border..."

"...if you take me there... she'll unmake me... and she'll unmake you for bringing me back..."

Requests

  1. Take her to the Docent's Archive — neutral ground, outside Kaedris's reach
  2. Don't take the passion-seed to the Bastion — Kaedris will feel it the moment it crosses the border
  3. Ask the Docent what to do with the seed

Quotes

"...she loved me once... before I ran..."

"...stole something... couldn't let her have it... couldn't let her burn the world with it..."

"...the Bastion isn't a place... it's her heart... literally her heart... she feels everything that enters..."
items.raw: Velara Ashyn Overview Velara Ashyn was once Kaedris's favorite — her consort, her lover. She stole the original passion-seed to prevent Kaedris from burning the world. She's been trapped in a soul anchor amulet for five hundred years, waiting. Appearance Velara's physical form is long dead. Her soul persists in the Soul Anchor Amulet: Dull metal, tarnished green Pulses with a heartbeat rhythm Grows cold when approaching the Bastion's influence Personality Grateful — to finally be found after 500 years Terrified — of returning to the Bastion Desperate — to reach Crownfall and the Docent Exhausted — after 500 years of imprisonment Hopeful — for the first time in centuries Background Kaedris's Consort Velara lived in the Heartspire at the center of the Bastion of Fireblood. She loved Kaedris. And Kaedris loved her — as much as something like the Sovereign of Passion can love. But Velara saw what Kaedris was becoming. What she wanted to become. The Discovery Kaedris found a way to amplify her power — to make the whole world feel as she does. She began breeding passion-seeds, fragments of concentrated emotion harvested from Aedwynn's heart. One seed can ignite a city. A hundred could burn the world. The Theft Velara stole the original — the first passion-seed, the one Kaedris cut from Aedwynn's heart with her own hands. Without it, the others are just echoes. With it, Kaedris could finish what she started. Velara ran. Five hundred years ago. The Flight Velara hired the Morrow Trading Company to take her far from the Bastion. Her contract specified no stops in Sovereign-controlled territory. Kaedris sent something to retrieve what was stolen. A shape in the heat shimmer. A woman — or something wearing a woman's shape. Beautiful. Burning. Feet that left glass in the dirt. She found the caravan in the Unclaimed. Everyone burned from the inside out. Velara was already dead when the burning woman arrived. The soul anchor amulet preserved her consciousness. She's been trapped

items.title: Velvet Thorn
items.content:
Velvet Thorn

Overview

The Innkeeper Profession: Innkeeper, Information Broker Location: The Velvet Thorn Inn, Coin District, Crownfall Status: Active

Velvet Thorn has run her establishment for 31 years. She has deep connections throughout the Unclaimed and maintains contacts in Veinspire, including Thessaly.

Appearance

A woman in her late fifties to early sixties who has aged into authority rather than frailty.

  • Build: Tall, composed, moves with deliberate grace
  • Hair: Silver-white, pulled back severely from her face
  • Face: Sharp cheekbones, deep-set eyes that miss nothing
  • Dress: Deep crimson velvet gown with high collar
  • Accessory: Single silver thorn-shaped brooch at her throat
  • Voice: Like aged whiskey — smooth, warm, with something sharp beneath

Personality

  • Composed: Nothing surprises her; she's seen everything
  • Assessing: Constantly reading people, calculating risks and opportunities
  • Discreet: Names don't go in her ledger unless clients want them there
  • Professional: Runs a clean establishment with clear rules
  • Connected: Knows Thessaly from Veinspire; has contacts throughout the Unclaimed

Background

The Velvet Thorn Inn:
  • Four-story building of dark wood and red stone
  • Sign: A rose wrapped in thorns, painted in silver and crimson
  • Red lanterns flank the entrance
  • Doorman the size of a small bear
Clientele:
  • Merchants in fine clothes
  • Sellswords in worn leather
  • People with money and secrets
  • Gray-cloaked professionals
Services:
  • Rooms (various quality levels)
  • Private dining rooms
  • Information (for the right price)
  • Discretion (included)

What They Know

About Seraphine Vale:
  • Arrived 12 days before the party with a young woman (Vela Thorne)
  • Stayed two nights, paid in gold
  • Spent a day at the Docent's Archive
  • Came back "looking like she'd seen a ghost"
  • Asked about routes to skirt the Bastion's border
  • Left through the southern gate
About the Bleeding Blade:
  • Recognizes it as dangerous — "hungry"
  • Can feel it "like standing near an open furnace"
  • Warned Jonas about the curse

Relationships

Thessaly

Connected through Veinspire contacts. Thessaly's clay token grants one night's accommodation.

The Party

  • Recognized Thessaly's token immediately
  • Provided one night's accommodation
  • Arranged private dining
  • Gave information about Seraphine Vale
  • Will receive word when Broma completes Jonas's shield commission

Quotes

"She doesn't send people to me lightly. And she doesn't send them at all unless they're either very useful or very desperate. Which are you?" "That's what Thessaly's favor buys you. One night. After that, we talk terms." "That one's hungry. I can feel it from here. Like standing near an open furnace — you don't see the heat, but your skin knows." "Make sure you're the one holding it — and not the other way around."

items.title: Veshra Coil
items.content:
Veshra Coil

Overview

The Madam — Protector of the Silken Refuge True Name: Veshra Coil Role: Owner of The Silken Refuge, Former Courtesan Status: Alive — Crownfall, The Sprawl Affiliation: Independent — deliberately unaligned with any House

Veshra Coil has spent thirty years building the Silken Refuge — not just a brothel, but a sanctuary. Every worker is a former slave she purchased and freed. They stay because they want to.

Appearance

A human woman in her fifties who has aged into iron rather than frailty. Weathered features that were once beautiful and are now commanding, silver-streaked dark hair swept back from her face, sharp eyes that can warm a room or freeze blood depending on her mood.

Tall, broad-shouldered, moves with the deliberate grace of someone who learned early that showing weakness invites predators. Wears well-tailored dresses in dark jewel tones, always with a high collar, always with an ornate cane she doesn't need for walking — but makes a fine weapon. Multiple rings on her fingers, each one bought with her own coin.

Personality

  • Fierce — Cross her people and discover why House Varn sends her a gift basket every Founding Day
  • Patient — She spent thirty years building this. She can wait.
  • Maternal — Every worker is her child, regardless of age
  • Unforgiving — She remembers every slight, every cruelty, every name
  • Pragmatic — Morality is a luxury. Survival comes first. Then revenge.

Background

Veshra started at the bottom — a young woman with nothing but her wits and her looks, working in a cheap brothel in the Kennels. She was good at her job. Better than good. She learned to read people, to know what they wanted before they did, to make powerful men feel safe enough to talk.

She listened. She remembered. She traded secrets for favors, favors for coin, coin for influence.

By thirty, she'd moved from the Kennels to a respectable house in the Spillway. By forty, she owned it. By forty-five, she'd bought out her competitors and built the Silken Refuge from the ground up — not just a brothel, but a sanctuary.

Somewhere along the way, she started buying slaves. Not for labor — for freedom. She'd seen too many girls broken by owners who saw them as property. She decided that anyone who worked for her would choose to be there. Would be protected. Would keep most of what they earned.

Thirty years of climbing taught her that power protects. Now she has enough power to protect everyone under her roof.

Relationships

Entity Relationship
House Keth Opposition — they deal in flesh, she frees it
House Varn Respect — they tried to shake her down once. Once.
House Drennan Rivalry — The Velvet Thorn is competition, but civil
The Docent Old friend — knew her when she was nobody
House Quellan Business — she trades in information too
Fursen Open invitation — treated her workers well

What They Know

Goals:
  • Her people safe and thriving
  • To see the slave trade in Crownfall ended — or at least driven underground
  • To never be powerless again
  • To die knowing the Refuge will outlast her

Key Moments

The Silken Refuge

Veshra's establishment in The Sprawl, near the border with The Spillway. A three-story building of dark timber and amber-lit windows that serves as both brothel and sanctuary.

What makes the Refuge different:
  • Every worker is a former slave purchased and freed by Veshra
  • They stay because they want to, leave when they choose
  • Protected with a ferocity that has earned respect even from House Varn's mercenaries
  • Workers keep 70% of their earnings
  • The Madam's word is final

Fursen's Visit (Day 15-16)

Fursen visited the Silken Refuge seeking companionship after the loss of his wisdom teeth to the Hollow Crawler. He spent the night with Scarlet and Cinder.

Veshra spoke to him as he left:

"You treated my girls well. They speak highly of you — and they don't say that about most."

"You're welcome back. Anytime. No payment required — just company and stories."

"A Leonin. I thought your people were gone... I'm glad to see I was wrong."

Fursen has an open invitation to return.

Quotes

"Everyone who walks through that door has a choice. Maybe for the first time in their lives. That's what we sell here. Not flesh. Choice."

items.title: Vorath
items.content:
Vorath

Overview

Vorath was a Tribunal assassin who hunted the Seven Heretics for thirty years. He was the final clue that revealed the truth of Elias's death and Kaleth's systematic murder of Mira's friends.

Appearance

  • Build: Thin
  • Hair: Grey-streaked
  • Distinguishing feature: Limp in left leg
  • Face: Forgettable — designed to blend in
  • Cover Identity: Trader passing through Dusthollow

Background

Vorath served as an assassin for the Tribunal, operating under the direction of Kaleth Vorn. His mission was to capture Mira Alethain alive and transport her to Veinspire for interrogation about the Arterial Texts.

The List

Vorath carried a list of seven names—six crossed out, one remaining:

  1. ~~Aldric Sarne~~ — Theologian
  2. ~~Elias Alethain~~ — Healer
  3. ~~Corwin Marsh~~ — Scholar
  4. ~~Daven Holt~~ — Chronicler
  5. ~~Bram Ashford~~ — Warrior-Priest
  6. ~~Adelaide Dunne~~ — Seer
  7. Mira Alethain — Pallid Crossroads

Key Moments

The Hunt

Mission:
  • Target: Mira Alethain (last of seven heretic priests)
  • Objective: Capture alive, transport to Veinspire
  • Purpose: Extract knowledge about the Arterial Texts
  • Overseer: High Inquisitor Seraphine Vale
Timeline in Dusthollow:
  • Day 1: Arrived, began observation
  • Day 4: Visited Crossroads as trader
  • Day 12: Used "Alethain" name as a test; Mira paused at "Sanguine Doctrine"
  • Day 15: Sent confirmation to Kaleth Vorn
  • Day 21: Party discovered his room, took all evidence
  • Day 22: Killed by Mira Alethain

Death & Interrogation

Vorath was caught preparing to flee at dawn. Jonas threw his hammer (missed, hit the horse instead), throwing Vorath from the saddle. He surrendered and offered information in exchange for his life—specifically demanding death as the price.

Mira killed him without hesitation.

Five Questions (Speak with Dead):
  1. Who is K? — "Kaleth Vorn. Tribunal Hand. Veinspire Catacomb. Seraphine's blade in shadow."
  1. Purpose of interrogating Mira about the Arterial Texts? — "The Texts contain the Vein-Mother's mortal writings. Her doubts. Her failures. The Tribunal must destroy them before they spread."
  1. Is Seraphine Vale still hunting the party? — "Four heretics. Fire mage. Branded warrior. Leonin escapee. The anomaly. Vale's secondary priority."
  1. State of Veinspire? — "Theorists scattered. Three cells discovered. Executions public. Leader Carveth fled or dead."
  1. High Inquisitor's current location? — "The Crimson Sanctum. Cathedral's upper spire."

The Revelation

When Mira saw the list of crossed-out names, she recognized them all:

  • Aldric Sarne — She thought his heart gave out. It was poison.
  • Elias Alethain — Her husband. She thought he died in the mountain passes. It was murder.
  • Corwin Marsh — She thought he'd found somewhere safe. He was killed in his sleep.
  • Daven Holt — They said he drowned himself. It was staged.
  • Bram Ashford — He just vanished. Ambushed.
  • Adelaide Dunne — Her letters stopped. Interrogated and executed.

For thirty years, Mira believed her friends had simply scattered and died to time and bad luck.

Vorath's letters revealed the truth: Kaleth Vorn murdered every single one of them.

This is why Mira is done running.

items.title: C-5 Divine Research Facility
items.content:
C-5 Divine Research Facility

Overview

Attribute Details
Type Pre-Sovereign Research Installation
Location Northern territory, near Vortegas's domain
Status Purged (structurally intact)
Era Pre-Usurpation

Description

The C-5 Divine Research Facility is an ancient installation predating the Sovereigns, built to study and contain divine material. The party discovered it while following the path of a Boundary Titan, finding the facility partially exposed in a collapsed area of the northern wastes.

The facility's purpose was the containment of "rejected divine material" — specimens created or modified using fragments of divine essence that proved too dangerous or unstable to release.

Key Areas

Terminus Ω-I

The main containment door, marked with scratches from a trapped worker. Behind it lay:

  • A dead worker who had been sealed inside
  • A null-flesh specimen
  • A logbook revealing the facility was sabotaged (lift-table removed intentionally)

Conduit Hub

The facility's power center. Jonas pulled a lever here that restored full power — and awakened the Preservation Custodian.

Subunit 6

A secondary power junction. The party forced it open (Natural 20) to partially restore power before reaching the main hub.

Biocell Storage

A chamber containing 18 specimen vats:

  • 1 black/shattered vat (empty, compromised)
  • 2 amber vats (contained Alpha and Beta specimens)
  • 15 green vats (status unknown)

Archive

Contains the facility's neural network. Sol discovered the specimens may have been connected, sharing information across the network.

Specimens

Designation Status Notes
Preservation Custodian Destroyed Guardian construct; deadly combat
Bioweapon Alpha Destroyed Released when Jonas shattered amber vat; fire proved effective
Bioweapon Beta Unknown Ambushed Jonas; party fled; possibly destroyed in Purge
Delta Series Unknown Referenced but never explained

The Purge

The party initiated Purge Stage 3, flooding the facility with lethal gas. They escaped via Exit 2 (Exit 3 failed — Natural 1), with Fursen inhaling toxin during the escape.

The facility is structurally intact but environmentally hazardous. The gas has since vented.

Logbook Revelations

The Terminus Ω-I logbook revealed:

  • The facility was deliberately sabotaged
  • Someone removed the lift-table to trap the worker
  • The specimens were being contained for research, not destruction
  • The facility predates the current Sovereign order

First Appearance

  • (discovered)
  • (explored)

items.title: Catacomb Reliquary
items.content:
Catacomb Reliquary

Description

The Catacomb Reliquary is where the Mareathan Church keeps what it doesn't want found. Relics too dangerous or heretical for the Grand Cathedral. Documents that contradict official doctrine. Prisoners who need to disappear entirely.

Savaros has been its High Keeper for longer than anyone can remember.

Access Routes

Official � Catacomb Gate

  • West side of Lesser Sacral District
  • Heavy Tribunal guard (4+ soldiers, rotating shifts)
  • Credentials checked, entries logged
  • 20-30 minutes from gate to Reliquary

Unofficial � Drainage Tunnels

  • Entry through Merchant Quarter (grate behind butcher's shop, Vein Street)
  • False wall with Mareathan symbols (third brick from left, chest height)
  • Connects to old catacombs
  • 45-60 minutes, moderate risk

Emergency � Arterial Passage

  • Beneath Church of the Merciful Vein
  • Living blood vessel of Mareatha
  • 15 minutes, high risk
  • Guarded by Coagulated Guardians
  • Requires Tribunal sigil or authorization

Known Layout

Lower Level (Party's Entry Point)

Antechamber:
  • Stone architecture � ancient, pre-current Church
  • Symbols in old Mareathan script (older than surface churches)
  • Shelves carved into walls with unidentified objects
  • Spiral staircase ascending
  • Doorway leading deeper into darkness
  • Arterial valve entrance (sealed after party's entry)
Atmosphere:
  • Complete darkness
  • Cold, dry air
  • Smell of dust, old paper, incense
  • Sound of paper turning from above

Upper Levels (Unexplored)

Known Features:
  • Main chamber where Savaros receives visitors (center of maze)
  • Maze-like layout � "only Savaros knows the full design"
  • Incense smell originates from upper levels
Suspected Contents:
  • The Martyr's Gauntlet (possibly)
  • Sacred relics
  • Forbidden documents
  • Prisoners (unconfirmed)

The High Keeper

Savaros resides in the Reliquary. According to Seraphine Vale:
  • Very old � remembers the Church before current hierarchy
  • Voice "sounds like paper tearing"
  • Never shows himself to those below Cardinal rank
  • Provides "guidance" that always gets followed
  • May possess the Martyr's Gauntlet

Entry

Route Used: Arterial Passage (fastest) Events:
  1. Party entered through Church of the Merciful Vein
  2. Descended into living blood vessel
  3. Encountered Coagulated Guardian patrol
  4. Fursen presented Tribunal sigil � recognized
  5. Authorization query � Fursen failed Deception (8)
  6. Combat � three guardians destroyed in one round
  7. Sprint to Reliquary � 2 minutes
  8. Emerged through arterial valve into Lower Level antechamber
  9. Valve sealed behind them, cutting off pursuit
Current Status:
  • Party in Lower Level antechamber
  • Savaros reading somewhere above (sound of turning pages)
  • Detection status unknown
  • Multiple paths forward: stairs up, doorway deeper

Potential Contents

Based on legends and intelligence:

Item Likelihood Notes
Martyr's Gauntlet Possible Cathedral vault is empty; may be here
Arterial Texts Possible Tribunal hunting Mira for knowledge of these
Confluence Components Likely Ritual requires relics
Forbidden Documents Certain Purpose of the Reliquary
Prisoners Possible "Prisoners who need to disappear"

AFTERMATH

What Happened

The party descended through the Arterial Passage and confronted Savaros in the main chamber.

Casualties:
  • Mira Alethain � Consumed by Savaros (reduced to skeleton)
  • Kael � Consumed by Savaros (reduced to skeleton)
  • Savaros � DESTROYED (Kael's indigestible flesh killed him)

Items Removed

Item Taken By
The Bleeding Blade Jonas (attuned)
Savaros's Ledger Party
Heretic's Silence Party
Truthseeker's Wand Party
Bottled Absence Party
The Confessor's Glass Party
The Flayer's Touch Party
~1,000 gold Party

Items Destroyed

Item Method
Brother Aldric's holy symbol Burned by Jonas
Keeper's Seal ring Burned by Jonas
Marek's letter Burned by Jonas
Alara's locket Burned by Jonas

Escape Route

The party escaped via a service passage behind shelving � Savaros's private entrance. Twenty minutes through narrow tunnels to a drainage culvert, emerging into The Dregs.

Current Status

Guardian: None (Savaros destroyed) Reliquary Contents: Largely intact, minus altar items Discovery Risk: High � Savaros's absence will be noticed "Follow the smell of old paper and older blood." � Seraphine Vale The smell now includes char and void-dust.
